alert.note: Alert for Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 11 at 6:17PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is ongoing. * WHERE...Stevens County. * WHEN...Until noon PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 PM PDT, Emergency management reported minor flooding on county and private roads across Stevens County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Colville, Chewelah, Kettle Falls, Northport, Springdale, Marcus, Addy, Arden, Orin, Valley, Gifford, Chewelah Peak, 49 Degrees North, Rice, Evans, Little Pend Oreille Lakes Campground, Cedonia, Loon Lake, Marble and Hunters. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
